name: Copamarina Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't believe this place is recommended as a great honeymoon or a romantic getaway for couples. Children took over the place from about 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. I don't know how anyone can call listening to 12 hours of Marco Polo being played relaxing.
reviews.title: A romantic getaway? I don't think so.

reviews.text: Children aside - the resort was beautiful, service was great, and I found the food at Alexandra to be superb. If I had kids, I might go back one day since I know I could just let them run amok and scream their heads off while I soak up some sun by the pool.
reviews.title: Our favorite family vacation spot

likes.liked: — Property design. It was well-considered and everything is located in close proximity.

reviews.text: We stayed at Copamarina for 5 nights after staying 1 night in San Juan (2/20-2/26). We will skip San Juan next time and go to Copamarina straight from the airport as it takes only 2-hour drive. We brought 7 years old and 3 years old, both loved the pool, kiddie pool and play ground. We did not choose All Inclusive package and that was the right choice for us as we saved $1000 over food and activities that we did not do. My husband did scuba diving twice (2 x $90), and I did Bodyderm spa massage ($80), and still saved that much money. We were disappointed that Alexandra restaurant was horrible. I ordered Oriental shrimp and the sauce was totally disgusting - believe me, any Chinese restaurant in your home town can do better. My husband ordered some Italian-like dish with pasta, and we agreed that nothing was fancy. Alexandra was supposed to be fancy with lots of $$$, but food is not worth the money at all. We drove to neighboring town and had much better dinner there. We stayed in Garden View room, but it was a bit small for our family. We looked at the Superior Garden View room and it had more space and looked nicer. Our Garden View room did not have a bath tub (just shower), but we were told that we just needed to ask for it as some rooms have bath tub. The resoft is relaxed and laid back, and stuff were friendly to make us feel comfortable. Overall, we liked this resort and want to go back again.
reviews.title: Nice Resort
Overall, the best resort in Puerto Rico
reviews.text: Copamarina is a nice resort in Guanica, Puerto Rico. Very friendly staff make for an enjoyable stay. The rooms were very nice for the carribean. They are a decent size. We had a nice balcony overlooking the beach and pool area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the restaurants was ok, but the service was great. Especially if you do the all-inclusive, which I highly recommend if you don't rent a car to go elsewhere.
reviews.title: A wonderful, relaxing escape at the Copamarina...
Relaxation, location, great diving.
reviews.text: We didn't actually stay here, but we will next time. We found this when we were trying to get a day of diving on the south wall, and all the boats out of Paraguera were full.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location can't be beat, the property is pristine, the dive op outstanding (and the wall is amazing), and there is plenty to do, or lots of deck chairs to do nothing if you so desire. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the facility is top notch.
reviews.title: Nice but not my favorite
Beautiful place management could improve
reviews.text: If you contact the hotel directly you can get much better deals than we found on-line.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we had been quoted the price we got when we went there for a day of diving, we would DEFINITELY have stayed there.
reviews.title: Everything we hoped for...

reviews.text: We just returned from staying at the Copamarina. It was nice but we found the front desk staff to have no personality at all. The hotel was clean and the view is beautiful. but after checking in to our room the connecting room wasn't locked and when we opened the door there was another family in the next room - changing no doubt! Had to wait awhile for this to be fixed since the door had nails keeping the lock from locking?? The safe needed a key that you had to pick up from the front desk (what's the point if the front desk has a key). Dinner at Alexandra was okay but when we asked to sit outside we were told that request couldn't be accomodated. When the couple next to us complained after being seated in the restaurant that they wanted to sit outside and they were told "no" they wouldn't take "no" for an answer and got seated outside. When we asked why they were granted outside seating after being seated inside, the staff told us they had reservations. When clearly they did not. They were out of pool towels and when they finally came in after the pool towel truck ran out of gas we were charged a 30.00 deposit for two towels (you do get this back after returning the towels, but let's get real) the towels aren't really that nice. On the whole it's not a bad hotel, it just didn't make us feel welcomed and we usually stay at Ramada's etc. So, we expected to be "welcomed" when we arrived, paying close to 300.00 a night. There's no vanity in the bathroom only a pedistal sink. The view is beautiful and if you're going to Puerto Rico to read a book then this is the place for you. If you want a friendly atomosphere then I'd go elsewhere.
reviews.title: What a great resort!

likes.disliked: — fuzzy tv reception but who has time to watch?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Copamarina is a great resort, with its own lovely beach, and chairs just in the water so that you can just lie there under the hay shade forever, without looking at anything you don't want to. The resort is large and very well maintained and they have these cool trips to GIlligan's island nearby. If you are lucky, you might catch the kayak trip to the island...takes about 25 mins and some good exercise to get there. The island is very nice with its mangrove forests and zero population and streams going through it.
reviews.title: Awesome place, but beware

likes.liked: — The relaxed, dreamy resort by the beach experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware the outdoor restaurant. They have ridiculously loong waiting times, even if you are the only customer! We waited for an HOUR for just a sandwich!
reviews.title: Very nice overall...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise, the resort is awesome, and the price of < $200 is also great.
reviews.title: Copa Marina - - More Than We Expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay here was very nice overall. Here are some thoughts for your consideration:
reviews.title: I heart Copamarina Mojiotos!

likes.disliked: — Not enough people to interact act with due to the season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1.) We are scuba divers and came here specifically to dive. The operation is run by Sea Ventures and they were great. Tony and Pedro took excellent care of us.
reviews.title: Amazing "The Best"
Only visited, but a great experience
reviews.text: We went into Copamarina just for a couple of drinks but i left later that afternoon with the desire of booking a weekend soon after. it had great view, very quiet, great people.. best place to go and relax. it is also near Guanica's "dry forest" which is a nice hike too.

If you liked Secret Harbour Beach Resort in St. Thomas, you'll love this, too. This is secluded and safe. The grounds are gorgeous. Palm trees, pools, and outdoor bar. No riff raff. No loud people. Grab a book, your laptop if you prefer to surf web from beach chair. The day side restaurant is okay and the nightside one is pretty good. There is nothing you can walk to outside the property, but who cares?
reviews.title: for refugees of the island life

likes.liked: — laid back and easy to walk to pool and beach from room.

reviews.text: Rent a car and visit Parguera or the Parador's restaurant there, for more local fare. This resort is in Guanica, it is not in Ponce, which Trip Advisor has it listed as such. Ponce is 30 minutes away to the east. If you drive north on Rt. 121 you'll be in the mountains of the central part of the island, you'll find spots for scenic views.
reviews.title: Great place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are nothing special, but adequate. There is a backdoor which leads to pool or ocean side, convenient on first floor.We were in the main building where open air lobby is.
reviews.title: Relaxing Vacation

reviews.text: Robin and I loved this place. Our baby had a great time in pool.
reviews.title: Very nice but

description: On Puerto Rico's undiscovered Southwestern coast is one of the Island's best-kept secrets. This beautifully landscaped, 20-acre tropical resort is situated on an isolated 3/4 mile crescent of Caribbean beachfront. The resort offers the finest in relaxation, dining, diving, sailing and eco-tourist wonders to create the perfect vacation experience. All inclusive package available.
